channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress
item.description: Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stal...

item.title: Some ant architects design a colony to cut the risk of disease. Humans, take note!
item.description: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.

item.title: ‘Cancer Doesn’t Care’: Citizen Lobbyists Unite To Push Past Washington’s Ugly Politics
item.description: Despite a poisonous political climate, hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer.

item.title: Cannabis blunts back pain in 2 new studies
item.description: Millions of Americans use weed to treat chronic pain, but there's little high quality research on whether it works. New findings suggest it can be eff...

item.title: Can collagen supplements improve your skin? Here's what the research shows
item.description: With age comes wisdom. And wrinkles. And joint pain. In wellness circles, the buzz is that collagen supplements can help with all these concerns. But ...

item.title: Private Medicare, Medicaid Plans Exaggerate In-Network Mental Health Options, Watchdogs Say

item.title: Grab the goggles. Pickleball eye injuries are on the rise
item.description: Safety precautions haven't caught up with enthusiasm for the sport. Researchers call for a new push for eye-ware.

item.title: States Jostle Over $50B Rural Health Fund as Trump’s Medicaid Cuts Trigger Scramble

item.title: ‘Chemtrail’ Theories Warn of Health Dangers From Contrails. The Idea Takes Wing at Kennedy’s HHS.
item.description: Get our weekly newsletter, The Week in Brief, featuring a roundup of our original coverage, Fridays at 2 p.m. ET.
